bio:
Jérôme Casse is a Postdoctoral Fellow of Mathematics at NYU Shanghai. He obtained his Ph. D. at University of Bordeaux (France) supervised by Jean-François Marckert. Prior to joining NYU Shanghai, he was a research and teaching assistant at Mines Nancy/Institut Elie Cartan de Lorraine in Nancy (France).

Research Interests

  • Probabilistic cellular automata
  • Vertex models
  • Stochastic processes iterated ad libitum

Courses taught

  • Recitations of Calculus
